answers.answer: I just had an ultrasound today too!!! 29 weeks. My baby girl is 2 lbs 10oz. she has been pretty small this whole time though. And my first was born only 6 lbs
Thats right on track, dont worry. At 27-28 weeks they measured my lil guy at 2lbs. But hes always been on the smaller side since the beginning.

I just had one at 29 weeks she is 3.7 lbs. On the high end but very healthy.  My husband s mom and my mom both had over 10 lb babies so I think it's genetics.  Dr said she's within range and has always been a tad bigger.  It's whatever your normal is as long as your within range your fine.  Some babies r born 6 lbs since r 10 lbs.

At 28 weeks my son was weighing 3lbs 6oz and he was already 18 inches long. I'm 32 weeks now so I'm sure he has gained even more weight. The doctor said he is on the bigger size but everything is great his health and mine. His daddy is 6'5 so we're thinking it's all genetics too.
That's what they told me, that she is big but still within normal range. Thanks ladies for sharing :-)
I'm 28wks and won't know how much he weighs till Wednesday
Gestational Diabetes can lead to big babies....most of us are tested for it at 28 weeks. If baby is too big, they will test you

My baby is tiny, but so was my son when he was born at 38wks he was 5pound15ounces & this bub at 26wks+3days was weighing at 1pound10ounces which us tiny and they said looks like she will be born tiny like my son.
29 weeks and he weighed 2 pounds 13 ounces

question: I'm 29 weeks today and had an ultrasound.  They said my baby weighs 3 lbs 3 oz. That seems pretty big to me. What do ur babies weigh or what did they weigh at 29 weeks?
title: 29 weeks
